events.name: Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin to meet at SCO summit
events.wd_label: Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin to meet at SCO summit
events.wd_description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan next week, marking their first face-to-face meeting since Russia invaded Ukraine.
events.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan next week, marking their first face-to-face meeting since Russia invaded Ukraine.

events.name: announcement by Russian envoy
events.wd_description: Russian Envoy to Beijing, Andrey Desinov, announced that Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin will meet at the SCO summit in Uzbekistan.
events.description: Russian Envoy to Beijing, Andrey Desinov, announced that Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin will meet at the SCO summit in Uzbekistan.

events.name: significance of the meeting
events.wd_description: The expected meeting will be the first face-to-face encounter between Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin since Russia invaded Ukraine.
events.description: The expected meeting will be the first face-to-face encounter between Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin since Russia invaded Ukraine.

events.name: Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the pandemic
events.wd_label: Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the pandemic
events.wd_description: This trip will be Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the early days of the pandemic and comes just weeks before a major political meeting in Beijing.
events.description: This trip will be Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the early days of the pandemic and comes just weeks before a major political meeting in Beijing.

events.name: importance of Russia-China relationship
events.wd_description: The scheduled meeting and the choice of destination for Xi's first overseas trip signal the importance of the Russia-China relationship, despite international backlash against Moscow since the Ukraine war.
events.description: The scheduled meeting and the choice of destination for Xi's first overseas trip signal the importance of the Russia-China relationship, despite international backlash against Moscow since the Ukraine war.

events.name: Flood and Humanitarian Crisis in Pakistan
events.wd_label: Flood and Humanitarian Crisis in Pakistan
events.wd_description: The intense monsoon season in Pakistan led to severe flooding, resulting in a humanitarian crisis with widespread displacement, significant loss of life, and damage to agriculture.
events.description: The intense monsoon season in Pakistan led to severe flooding, resulting in a humanitarian crisis with widespread displacement, significant loss of life, and damage to agriculture.

events.name: Intense Monsoon
events.wd_description: The World Meteorological Organization reported an unusually intense monsoon season in Pakistan and northwest India, with some areas in Sindh receiving over 1,288 millimeters of rain in August.
events.description: The World Meteorological Organization reported an unusually intense monsoon season in Pakistan and northwest India, with some areas in Sindh receiving over 1,288 millimeters of rain in August.

events.name: Flooding and Casualties
events.wd_description: The flooding caused by the monsoon has been described as the worst disaster in Pakistan's history, with 1,100 deaths, 2,600 injuries, and millions displaced, along with significant agricultural losses.
events.description: The flooding caused by the monsoon has been described as the worst disaster in Pakistan's history, with 1,100 deaths, 2,600 injuries, and millions displaced, along with significant agricultural losses.

events.name: Government and UN Response
events.wd_description: The Pakistani government is conducting rescue operations, while the United Nations launched a $116 million campaign to support flood victims.
events.description: The Pakistani government is conducting rescue operations, while the United Nations launched a $116 million campaign to support flood victims.

events.name: Sichuan province factories shut down due to power shortage from heat wave
events.wd_label: Sichuan province factories shut down due to power shortage from heat wave
events.wd_description: All factories in Sichuan province, China, were forced to shut down for six days to ease a power shortage caused by a severe heat wave.
events.description: All factories in Sichuan province, China, were forced to shut down for six days to ease a power shortage caused by a severe heat wave.

events.name: factory shutdown
events.wd_description: All factories in Sichuan province were ordered to shut down for six days to address the power shortage caused by a heat wave.
events.description: All factories in Sichuan province were ordered to shut down for six days to address the power shortage caused by a heat wave.

events.name: impact on semiconductor and solar panel industries
events.wd_label: impact on semiconductor and solar panel industries
events.wd_description: Sichuan is a key manufacturing location for the semiconductor and solar panel industries, affecting major companies like Apple supplier Foxconn and Intel.
events.description: Sichuan is a key manufacturing location for the semiconductor and solar panel industries, affecting major companies like Apple supplier Foxconn and Intel.

events.name: extreme heat wave
events.wd_description: China is experiencing its worst heat wave in 60 years, with temperatures exceeding 40 degrees Celsius (104 degrees Fahrenheit), increasing demand for air conditioning and straining the power grid.
events.description: China is experiencing its worst heat wave in 60 years, with temperatures exceeding 40 degrees Celsius (104 degrees Fahrenheit), increasing demand for air conditioning and straining the power grid.

events.name: analyst's note
events.wd_description: Daiwa Capital analyst noted that the factory shutdown could tighten the supply of polysilicon and lithium, pushing prices higher.
events.description: Daiwa Capital analyst noted that the factory shutdown could tighten the supply of polysilicon and lithium, pushing prices higher.

events.name: EV battery supply chain
events.wd_description: The supply chain for EV batteries, particularly lithium-ion batteries, is under increasing strain due to rising demand for electric vehicles and geopolitical and environmental challenges.
events.description: The supply chain for EV batteries, particularly lithium-ion batteries, is under increasing strain due to rising demand for electric vehicles and geopolitical and environmental challenges.

events.name: production
events.wd_description: The production of lithium-ion batteries is heavily reliant on mining and processing of raw materials, which are concentrated in a few key countries and subject to geopolitical risks.
events.description: The production of lithium-ion batteries is heavily reliant on mining and processing of raw materials, which are concentrated in a few key countries and subject to geopolitical risks.

events.name: t: China’s dominance
events.wd_description: China controls a significant portion of the global lithium-ion battery supply chain, including 79% of battery production and 61% of lithium refining.
events.description: China controls a significant portion of the global lithium-ion battery supply chain, including 79% of battery production and 61% of lithium refining.

events.name: t: geopolitical risks
events.wd_description: Events like COVID-19 and the war in Ukraine have disrupted the supply chain, affecting the availability of critical materials such as cobalt, lithium, and nickel.
events.description: Events like COVID-19 and the war in Ukraine have disrupted the supply chain, affecting the availability of critical materials such as cobalt, lithium, and nickel.

events.name: t: U.S. initiatives
events.wd_description: The U.S. is investing in domestic production and processing of lithium-ion batteries, including a $2.91 billion initiative by the DOE to boost production and recycling facilities.
events.description: The U.S. is investing in domestic production and processing of lithium-ion batteries, including a $2.91 billion initiative by the DOE to boost production and recycling facilities.

events.name: t: new technology
events.wd_description: Innovations such as those by Lilac Solutions and Princeton NuEnergy aim to improve lithium recovery and battery recycling, easing supply chain constraints.
events.description: Innovations such as those by Lilac Solutions and Princeton NuEnergy aim to improve lithium recovery and battery recycling, easing supply chain constraints.

events.name: price
events.wd_description: The price of lithium has surged due to increased demand for batteries, rising over 900% since 2021, affecting the cost of electric vehicles and prompting contract renegotiations.
events.description: The price of lithium has surged due to increased demand for batteries, rising over 900% since 2021, affecting the cost of electric vehicles and prompting contract renegotiations.

events.name: t: inflation
events.wd_description: Inflation has exacerbated the rising costs of lithium-ion batteries, leading to higher prices for electric vehicles and delays in project commissioning.
events.description: Inflation has exacerbated the rising costs of lithium-ion batteries, leading to higher prices for electric vehicles and delays in project commissioning.

events.name: transportation/flammability
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries are regulated as hazardous materials due to their flammability and high energy density, which pose risks during transportation and storage.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries are regulated as hazardous materials due to their flammability and high energy density, which pose risks during transportation and storage.

events.name: t: regulation
events.wd_description: The U.S. Department of Transportation regulates lithium-ion batteries as hazardous materials, requiring companies to take precautions during transactions and transport.
events.description: The U.S. Department of Transportation regulates lithium-ion batteries as hazardous materials, requiring companies to take precautions during transactions and transport.

events.name: t: fire risk
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries can overheat and ignite under certain conditions, making fires difficult to extinguish and posing significant risks during transport.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries can overheat and ignite under certain conditions, making fires difficult to extinguish and posing significant risks during transport.
